name: CUSHIONAIRE Women's Lane Cork Footbed Sandal With +Comfort

title: 2nd time was a charm
content: We had a bit of a pickle with this one. We ordered the sandals, received the sandals, and noticed that each shoe was a different size! How does that happen? - anyway, we returned it with no issue and received the correct order on the 2nd go-around. These are for my daughter and she loves them. They are comffy, look like the expensive brand, do not cost as much as the expensive brand, and she loves them! Definitely order a half size or one size up.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I saw some of the reviews were mixed on sizing. I’m 5’10 and a size 10 shoe. I’ve never in my life had to upsize until I got these. The 10’s were very narrow, my heel was slightly over the edge and I had tons of toe cleavage. Not a good look. I was a little mixed on quality they definitely were less quality of Birks but I didn’t want to pay Birks price right now. I returned the 10 ‘s and got 11 wide. I have never worn an 11 wide in my life and I’m a little traumatized but hey they fit and I saved some money for now.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 29, 2024

title: Size up
content: First and foremost these are great shoes! I find them comfortable and easy to wear all day without issue.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: Some things to keep in mind:
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2024

title: Size up!
content: 1) you definitely need to size up. I usually wear a 10 in every brand but these I needed an 11 and I have literally no wiggle room
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: 2) the toe is very pointed in the big toe area and if your toes aren’t the same shape then they’ll hurt
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2024

title: Pleasantly surprised
content: 3) the arch support is veryyyyy minimal if any
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 30, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: I have only worn these sandals for one day but so far they are a keeper. First off I did order a half size up from my normal size of 7.5 so the size 8 is the right length. I have another pair of cushionaire in a different style and the 7.5 is long so it was odd that this style is sized a bit differently. The foot bed is comfortable in fact more cozy than the name brand sandal that I own that has a hard footbed. I was able to wear them right out of the box and there was no break in period. A few things about this sandal is that the style is a bit square in the width so for people who do not have much girth to their foot, they feel a bit loose and the straps are not easy to adjust so I just left them the way their arrived. With this style there is a lip that trails along the toe edge and I have to be carefully not to walk too fast or wear for too long as my toes will be irritated by that edge. But overall I was able to wear them all day at work, granted I sit at my desk most of the day, but they were comfy and quiet to walk in. I think for the price they are an excellent alternative to the name brand look alike.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 4, 2024

title: Cute and Fits Wide Feet
content: I needed some non fancy navy blue slip ons, and these fit the bill. The foot bed is comfortable but stiff, and are wide enough to fit my wide foot. They're not so great that I'd get them in every color, but they're good enough for a slip on and go sandal.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: My birks were worse for wear after 5 years of heavy use. I got these to use on a family vacation and because I didn’t want to spend $150 on a new pair. These are great dupes. They’re comfortable and come in a variety of colors.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on June 11, 2024

title: Just try them!
content: Since these are back in style, and I never had a “name brand” pair, I thought I’d try these. I’ve been wearing them over the last 2 months or so. I’m not sure how comfortable they would be walking around, since I’ve mainly worn them to work a desk job and just running out to grab a few things from the store, but they are super cute. Worth a try if you like the style.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: These sandals look just like Birkenstocks and are very comfortable.  I spend a lot of time on my feet and my feet don’t hurt at the end of the day when I wear these.  The only downside is they wear out a lot quicker than Birkenstocks.

content: I have worn these sandals practically everywhere all summer long. They are comfortable even for a day at the amusement park with lots of standing/walking. I will defiantly be buying more once the ones I have are worn out. They also look cute with just about any outfit!

content: The delays in delivery was a bit long as I ordered them for my granddaughter for school and they kept getting delayed. My granddaughter loves them.

title: Verified Purchase

title: They’re super comfortable and stylish,
content: "My daughter "had to have" these CUSHIONAIRE sandals, and now all her friends have them too! She absolutely loves them—they’re super comfortable and stylish, with the cork footbed providing great support for all-day wear. She wears them everywhere, and they look great with everything from jeans to dresses. The quality is fantastic, and they’re holding up really well, even with constant use. It’s no surprise that these sandals have become the go-to for her and her friends. If you’re looking for trendy, comfy footwear, these are a must-have!"

title: Verified Purchase
content: These sandals are very comfortable. I ordered the stone nubuck 10W since I wear XX wide shoes. Because of the adjustable buckles I was able to fit in these.  Love the color which will blend in well with all outfits.  I gave a 4 star review because they run short.  I normally wear a size 10 and had to exchange them for an 11. These are going to be perfect for the summer and my upcoming Mexico vacay!

title: Comfort at a great price.
content: run and add to cart immediately! They are so comfortable and feel more cushion-y and supportive than the real Birkenstocks.  I walked 7mi in them around NYC, my first time wearing them and my feet never hurt or got blistered. Absolutely in love with this purchase, plus who doesn’t want to save two-thirds the price with two day shipping and so many color/design options!! ✅

title: Verified Purchase

title: cute but small
content: I have found these to be some of the most comfortable sandals I've purchased recently. When I wear them a decent length of time my feet get a little raw on the bottom outside edge by my pinky toes - otherwise absolutely no discomfort! They seem supportive but cushy too. I probably will be purchasing a second pair in the future. (I do like that the straps are adjustable as I have wide feet. I also went with my normal size which was half a size larger than amazon recommended)

title: comfy and worth it

title: Verified Purchase
content: Very comfy! Fit TTS. The fabrication is a little cheap looking if you examine closely. They look cute at a distance. Why will shoemakers put a white sole on a black and tan animal print? It really cheapens the appearance. But for 29 to run around in the summer at the beach, they are fine. Looks cute with white jeans, shorts and shirts and a black tee.

title: Sole should be black
content: I have other similar sandals by the more popular brand name but thought I’d give these a try and see if they were up to par for less money. They are very comfortable and fit to size. I wear them often with jeans, maxi dresses and shorts. They did stretch a bit with wear but the adjustable straps are great to tighten them back up. I always seem to have good luck with Comfortaire shoes.

title: Verified Purchase

title: Comfortable and cute
content: I have worn these shoes ALLLLLLLLLL summer. I did not want to spend $100 on the classic ones and these seemed just as good. I have a hard time with sandals like these getting smelly after one summer and there has been no issues whatsoever. They are perfect. I would not recommend for walking dogs, I did get a blister on the bottom of my foot but that was user error because I wear them looser. But like I said, user error. I would recommend these shoes 100% and will be ordering them again when these give out.

title: Verified Purchase
content: While they are comfortable and softer than real Birks, I would say the run a bit smaller and more narrow. I’m a solid 11.5 and ordered 12 as some others have noted the sizing. They JUST fit. I would recommend sizing up if you’re a half size and if you actually need a wide shoe, these likely won’t cut it. While my feet are not narrow, I generally never need to purchase wide. In these, I needed wide with the straps buckled on the loosest hole.

title: Good fit, cushioned well
content: These were a good fit, cushioned well but without arch support. They have a thickness to the sole, but would not recommend to anyone needing arch support as they are very flat in the foot bed.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: So I bought the viral Cushionaire Birkenstock dupes on prime day b/c I’ve been wanting Birks for awhile but they’re too pricey. I ordered two diff sizes b/c the reviews were all over on sizing. Spoiler alert - the 9.5 and 10 I got were the exact same size and width. So which color do I choose ? The oily brown seem to look more like leather but maybe the “rustic brown” on the left might be more versatile in color? I saw in another review photo that the oily brown color tends to show scuff marks easily, but it does make it look a little bit more like real leather like that. If this doesn’t bother you, I think that the oily brown looks More like natural, leather, and less plastic PU leather. They seem pretty comfortable out of the box, but I don’t know which ones to return.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on July 24, 2024

content: So incredibly comfortable and look just like the real deal. I am obsessed with these and will buy more. If you are thinking of buying, do it!

title: Love these shoes
content: I have plantar fasciitis that comes and goes, along with an old ankle surgery so I do need supportive footwear and adequate toe room for proper alignment.  I started feeling tight in my calves and feet at the beginning of sandal weather this year, and then I purchased these.  Since then, my feet have been doing great all summer.  They did take a week or so to break in but even then, they were not uncomfortable.  The material is soft feeling, the soles are supportive with the right amount of firmness and cushion, and (for me) they go great with a variety of styles.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: It’s obviously not an exact dupe but still an awesome shoe on its own. Got this to wear on vacation so I don’t ruin my Birkenstocks. The Cushionaire feels higher since it has more of a cushion under the foot. My birkenstocks are older and worn in so they’re more comfortable and softer, but these are still very comfortable to wear immediately. So far the top strap feels kinda hard and is occasionally irritating but I would think with time it will soften and loosening it did help. Will keep these and see how they wear.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2024
